@mz_knewton how do you tell if someone who serves you is a "migrant"?
@mz_knewton we don't take 100k unskilled migrants. Also employment is rising so we actually do need most of the people who are coming.
There are taps.
I will never comprehend people who lug ungainly four litre water containers around the gym.
This literally says people working in petrol stations and supermarkets have different faces. About as racist as youâ€¦ https://t.co/cVAPXxxinV
@ToddAtticus Trumpism thrives on being condemned, by the media, the "political class" etc. It probably extends to the rest of the world too.
@ToddAtticus for sure but I just don't think it makes a difference to get hung up on who has condemned what. In fact it might make it worse.
We should do what we can, but be realistic. We need our relationship with America in good shape in four years when they get a new President.
But it doesn't help to direct impotent rage at President Trump, by simply "condemning" him and his actions.
And it would be nice to hear him say that it is not in line with New Zealand values to discriminate against groups of refugees and migrants.
It would be nice to hear from the PM about what his government will do when there is a global refugee crisis but other countries say "no".
@JimRose69872629 @LewisHoldenNZ @damienmgrant I don't feel deprived. Think it's funny she used my photo and claimed to be doing a "clearout"
@damienmgrant oh absolutely I'm not bothered just think it is hilarious
Gave away my shitty old bed frame for free on Vic Deals. Lady picked it up today and she's already selling on anothâ€¦ https://t.co/aABRuvfBxN
Peter Dunne has been in politics for like 200 years, and his mission right now? Shifting the school holidays by a month.
Great interview with Dame Patsy Reddy. I'm such a fan. https://t.co/aQQvxKwGTq
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr clearly not. Just as we can't set $50/hr and eradicate deprivation overnight. Think we agree there's a balance
If I read that Womens Marches are "protests against democracy" one more time I will scream
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr but few businesses are the size of RB. Also strong case that RB would reduce hours/staffing under high min wage
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr but I think this will be the point where we reach a more fundamental disagreement ðŸ˜¬ðŸ˜…
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr yes I agree. But the parents of the other 60% may be trapped out of work if the minimum wage is set *too* high
@richardhills777 @Tim_McCready similar feelings from over here. And politics is better when not treated as a blood sport.
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr everyone would. But the way the church arrives at the LW rate presumes 1.5 full time incomes raising 2 kids etc
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr in some ways the living wage argument supports exemptions for youth bc the calculation presumes you have kids
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr I agree we should have higher wages but the LW math depends on assumptions that aren't true of most people.
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr yes they are time-limited and only for 16/17 year olds - and fixed at 80% of the minimum wage.
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr well it's different and it's not how I'd want it here
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr correction: 2/3 the adult wage
@richardhills777 @ughwhtevr yep and the wage for 18 y/o is only ~2/3 what it is here. Very different in lots of ways.
@ughwhtevr their main minimum wage is high but there are a lot of lower rates for younger people and apprentices etc. Also higher income tax

This is my proposal to deal with the Wellington rental housing shortage.
And if you write "Courtney Place" or "Lampton Key" you would be sent back to wherever you came from
There should be like a citizenship test before you move to Wellington. You just would have to correctly spell a few well-known street names.
And we're not a perfect country by any stretch, but people in NZ have access to welfare, health, education. That's pretty rare in the world.
I agree that inequality (especially caused by the cost of housing) is a problem. But it's not caused by Graeme Hart. https://t.co/w2felnNvRI
